channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Photographer Hannah Kobayashi’s disappearance linked to mystery man and a potential scam
item.description: Photographer Hannah Kobayashi, who disappeared from Los Angeles, was seen spending nine hours with a man before traveling to Mexico. Police cleared the man of any involvement, confirming Kobayashi left alone and voluntarily crossed the border. A possible marriage scam involving an Argentinian man and family tensions further complicate the situation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Senator Ernst raises concerns over Hegseth’s nomination for defence secretary
item.description: Senator Joni Ernst, a combat veteran, expresses reservations about Pete Hegseth's nomination for defense secretary, citing concerns about his views on women in combat and past allegations. Hegseth faces scrutiny over sexual assault accusations and a lack of Pentagon experience, while other Republican senators also seek further information before confirming his nomination.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Syrian ousted president Bashar al-Assad in Russia: Report
item.description: Bashar al-Assad and his family have found asylum in Moscow after fleeing Damascus as Islamist-led opposition forces took control of the Syrian capital. Celebrations erupted in Syria following the rebels' swift advance, ending the Assad family's five-decade rule.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Internet reacts as Trump and Jill Biden share candid moment at Notre Dame reopening
item.description: During the reopening of Notre Dame Cathedral, President-elect Donald Trump and outgoing First Lady Jill Biden shared a warm, viral moment. This fueled online speculation about Jill Biden's stance on Trump, particularly given prior instances interpreted by some as signs of covert support.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Brian Thompson case: Nationwide manhunt for UnitedHealthCare CEO’s killer continues
item.description: A nationwide manhunt is underway for the gunman who fatally shot UnitedHealthCare CEO Brian Thompson in Midtown Manhattan. The suspect, seen fleeing on an electric bike and later in a taxi, is believed to have left New York City shortly after the attack. A backpack possibly belonging to the suspect was found in Central Park.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Assad is gone': Trump, Netanyahu, other world leaders react to Damascus falling to rebels
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When USA called Syria rebel leader Abu Mohammed al-Jolani a terrorist
item.description: In 2017, the US Embassy in Syria declared Abu Mohammed al-Jolani, leader of Hay’at Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), a terrorist. The US asserted that HTS, despite rebranding efforts, remained an al-Qaeda extension, with Jolani at its helm. This designation highlighted the complex dynamics of the Syrian conflict and raised questions about US involvement with extremist groups.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Deport all Illegal immigrants, exit Nato, pardon Jan 6 defendants: Trump lays out his agenda
item.description: In his first post-election interview, President-elect Trump outlined his second-term agenda, including pardons for January 6th rioters, ending birthright citizenship, and mass deportations. He also discussed potential NATO withdrawal, tariffs, and a more unifying message than his previous inaugural address. Surprisingly, Trump met with Macron and Zelenskyy in Paris after the interview to discuss peace in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Child's first heartbreak shouldn't be from father', says Roberts as Hunter Biden yet to meet their daughter
item.description: Lunden Roberts, mother of Hunter Biden's child, reveals his continued absence from their daughter's life. Hunter has not met Navy and stopped communicating with her eight months ago. Roberts and Biden had a relationship between 2016 and 2018. A DNA test confirmed Hunter's paternity. Roberts claims Hunter has missed key moments in Navy's life.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Fall of Assad: Israel PM says military has seized buffer zone in Golan Heights
item.description: Israeli forces secured a buffer zone in the Golan Heights after Syrian rebels ousted President Bashar al-Assad, ending his family's rule. Prime Minister Netanyahu declared this a "historic day," attributing it to Israeli actions against Iran and Hezbollah, Assad's allies. Israel's annexation of the Golan Heights remains internationally disputed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chinese woman wins over Rs 1 lakh for being away from phone for 8 hours
item.description: A woman in China won 10,000 yuan after successfully abstaining from mobile phone use for eight hours in a competition. Ten contestants lay on beds in a shopping mall, prohibited from using electronic devices except for basic calls. The winner, nicknamed "pyjama sister," maintained the lowest anxiety levels and spent the most time in bed, achieving a score of 88.99.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why United is taking families to 'North Pole' on free 'fantasy flights'
item.description: United Airlines launched its Fantasy Flights program, taking children facing hardship on a magical journey to the 'North Pole.' Flight 3894 from Honolulu marked the start, with 125 children and their families enjoying a festive experience. Thirteen such flights are planned across the globe, spreading holiday cheer to families affected by military loss or childhood cancer.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Where Turkey stands as Syrian government falls to opposition insurgents
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 3 security personnel killed in terror attacks in Pakistan's Balochistan province
Endless stories: Celebrating the lives of the world's oldest people
Where is Bashar al-Assad? Vanished plane from radar deepens mystery amid rebel takeover
item.description: Rebels seized Damascus, ending Assad's 24-year reign. He reportedly fled on a plane whose fate is unknown. His family's location is also unconfirmed. The swift rebel advance leaves Syria's future uncertain, with Assad's whereabouts a mystery. The rebel offensive, which began a week ago with the surprise capture of northern Aleppo, quickly snowballed. Cities fell one after another as Assad’s forces were unable to hold their ground.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Syrians storm presidential palace, loot Assad’s personal belongings
item.description: Syrian dictator Bashar al-Assad fled Damascus as opposition forces entered the capital, encountering minimal resistance. Citizens celebrated, storming the presidential palace and toppling Assad statues. Rebel groups, including some with al-Qaeda ties, seized state media and declared imminent victory after capturing Homs, a key city.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Stability or civil war? What lies ahead for post-Assad Syria
item.description: Islamist-led rebels seized control of Damascus on Sunday, compelling President Bashar al-Assad to flee and ending over five decades of Baath Party rule. Celebrations erupted in the streets as the rebels declared the city liberated.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Rescuers search for victims after explosion at Dutch apartment block that killed at least 5
Romanian police raid homes after presidential election declared invalid
item.description: Romanian prosecutors raided houses in Brasov following the invalidation of the first-round presidential election due to allegations of Russian interference and campaign irregularities. The court's decision cancels the planned second-round vote, and a new election date will be set. The investigation focuses on illegal campaign funding and potential ties to far-right candidate Calin Georgescu, who unexpectedly won the first round.
